name: coastline sunburst hexie blanket
notes:
coastline sunburst hexie blanket pattern

*****this pattern is available for free on my website at: https://www.nautikrallcrochet.com/blog-freepatterns/coastlinesunbursthexieblanket
(this listing is for those who wish to have an advertisement free pattern or printable copy).

we’re coming up on summer and this project is worthy of sandy coastlines and sun dried driftwood. i gravitated towards these colours because i’m craving all the beach vibes right now—living in the midst of some of the biggest lakes in the world means i’m surrounded by water (literally!) and it’s apart of my soul. for those who know me or who’ve been following from the beginning…you know that i’m a lover of the water and sailing. this blanket (and the next few patterns to follow) will be indicative of just that. earthy, beachy, sun-kissed with just a hint of sparkling water. 

i truly hope you enjoy this relaxing make. with a smaller selection of colours, no colour changes and motifs that are packable—this project promises to be the bring-a-long staple. join them all up later with a continuous join as you go for hexagons and you’ve got yourself the perfect project to ring in the summer with. happy crocheting :)


this pattern is worked up using the large sunburst hexagon. 

the pattern uses wecrochet (knit picks) wool of the andes worsted (110yds/50g) and a 5mm hook (size h).
pattern includes all colours used and the yarn quantities as well as exact positioning. my gift to you is taking the work out of colourwork!

the final blanket size was: approximately 46"x 62" inches.

pattern will include:
- yarn amounts/quantities.
- yarn colours/colour legend
- stitch glossary.
- printable pdf of blanket graph.
- full colour chart of all squares and their positioning so you can make this exact colour copy!
- full written instruction for the hexagon used (large sunburst hexie).
- written and video tutorial for border.
- video tutorials for the hexie as well as the continuous join as you go method (cjayg).

happy crocheting everyone!
